text: Acleris platynotana is a species of moth of the family Tortricidae. It is found in China, Japan (Hokkaido, Honshu) and the Russian Far East. The habitat consists of rhododendron groves and black birch-oak-pine forests. The wingspan is 16–21 mm.Japanese Moths Adults have been recorded on wing from May to June and again from August to October in Japan.Lepidopterous Fauna of the USSR and Adjacent Countries The larvae feed on Ilex pedunculosa, Lyonia ovalifolia, Rhododendron kaempferi, Rhododendron molle and Quercus glauca.Tortricidae Food Plant Database They feed within the rolled leaves of their host plant. Larvae can be found in June. The species overwinters as an adult. ==References== Category:Moths described in 1900 platynotana Category:Moths of Asia
title: Acleris platynotana
